name: Shashaying with Wyverns
description: The end-all be-all of Expert Mode. This set is all about Draconic Evolution, and the things it unlocks.

quests.name: Customizing Your Custom Worlds
quests.description: In order to define how your dimension is generated, you can use Dimlets. A good source of Unkown Dimlets is a large mob farm. For the most part, Dimlets can go into the Dimension Inscriber in any order. However, Material and Liquid Dimlets MUST go in the slot just before thing they are supposed to modify. For instance, having Large Spheres of Diamond Blocks, you would need to have the Diamond Blocks Material Dimlet in the slot 1 to the left of the Large Spheres Dimlet.

tasks.longDescription: Put the Unknown Dimlet into the Dimlet Researcher to learn what it does.

quests.name: F5 F5 F5 F5 F5 F5 F5
quests.description: Sometimes you get a bunch of really useless Dimlets that you don't want. You can put 3 into a Dimlet Scrambler and they will be destroyed and give you one random Dimlet.

quests.name: World Hopping
quests.description: RFTools dimensions are extremely RF intensive. Don't forget to bring a Porter!

tasks.longDescription: Without Dimlets, Dimensions are entirely random as far as traits go. Twilight Forest biome with multicolored Hardened Clay? Anything can happen. The Dimension Enscriber doesn't require RF, just an Empty Dimension Tab. Put that in, and if you have any Dimlets you want, stick those in too. Click "Store" to make the dimension.

Put the Realized Dimension Tab into the Dimension Builder. Dimensions require a ton of RF to build for the first time, and then continued RF to keep it on. The more complicated or intense the Dimension, the more RF it takes.

quests.name: This Is Going To Be Easy!
quests.description: These Cores are the  base ingredients for most recipes.

tasks.longDescription: The Draconic Core is probably the easiest thing you will ever craft in this Draconic Evolution
The Wyvern Core is 4 times the probable easiest thing you will make in Draconic Evolution, plus other stuff.

quests.name: Need This and This and This...
quests.description: Mana Dust is required to make certain things in Draconic Evolution. It's so confusing to make, I spelled it out for you here.
prerequisites: This Is Going To Be Easy!

tasks.longDescription: 360mB of Primal Mana is required to make 1 Mana Dust. the smallest amount you can make at a time is 576mB. This takes 1 Ardite Ingot, 2 Obsidian blocks, 144mB of TiCon Blood, 1 Cobalt Ingot, 1 Iron Ingot, 4 Draconium Ingots, and 2,000mB of OpenBlocks Liquid XP.

quests.name: Diggy Diggy Hole
quests.description: The Pickaxe of the Wyvern is one of the best pickaxes in the game.  Check you Controls for "Tool and Armour Config GUI", and press that. Click the Pickaxe of the Wyvern, and you can modify the dig speed multiplier, area of effect, and whether or not it stops you from digging Tile Entities. The "Inv" tab allows you to place Enchanted Books into the item, which will enchant it. You can later remove these if you want.
prerequisites: Need This and This and This...

tasks.description: Make the Pickaxe of the Wyvern
tasks.longDescription: I swear the only reason I'm using a Diamond Pickaxe for the icon is because the Pickaxe of the Wyvern shows up as blank. It's not my fault, I swear!

quests.name: The Sword in the Lake
quests.description: The Sword of the Wyvern is one of the most powerful ranged weapons in the game. Check you Controls for "Tool and Armour Config GUI", and press that. Click the Sword of the Wyvern, and you can change the AoE, similar to the TiCon Scythe.
prerequisites: Need This and This and This...

tasks.description: Make the Sword of the Wyvern
tasks.longDescription: In addition to the 20 attack damage (10 hearts), an additional 10% of the mob's health is removed. This means most mobs can be defeated in 10 hits or less, except for certain bosses that cap out damage like the Guardian of Gaia.

quests.name: I Swear There Was Dirt Here
quests.description: The Shovel of the Wyvern is one of the best pickaxes in the game.  Check you Controls for "Tool and Armour Config GUI", and press that. Click the Shovel of the Wyvern, and you can modify the dig speed multiplier, area of effect, and whether or not it stops you from digging Tile Entities. The "Inv" tab allows you to place Enchanted Books into the item, which will enchant it. You can later remove these if you want.
prerequisites: Need This and This and This...

tasks.description: Make the Shovel of the Wyvern
tasks.longDescription: I swear the only reason I'm using a Diamond Shovel for the icon is because the Shovel of the Wyvern shows up as blank. It's not my fault, I swear!

quests.name: Ratatatatatata
quests.description: The Bow of the Wyvern is one of the most powerful ranged weapons in the game. Check you Controls for "Tool and Armour Config GUI", and press that. Click the Bow of the Wyvern, and you can modify several values. The more powerful you make the bow, the more RF it takes per shot. The "Inv" tab allows you to place Enchanted Books into the item, which will enchant it. You can later remove these if you want.
prerequisites: Need This and This and This...

tasks.description: Make the Bow of the Wyvern

quests.name: Here to There
quests.description: The Charm of Dislocation allows you to teleport from anywhere in any dimension to a specific location for absolutely no cost. However, it can only have one location, and cannot be rebound. Shift right click to save the coords, dimension, and direction you are looking. Right click anywhere else to teleport there.
prerequisites: This Is Going To Be Easy!

tasks.longDescription: You don't have to look at a block while binding it, otherwise you would be looking straight down when you teleport there. Just look straight ahead, or the direction you want to be looking when you teleport there.

quests.name: Wyverns Don't Have Arms
quests.description: Wyvern armor some of the most powerful armor in Expert Mode. The Leggings and Boots of the Wyvern can be configured to let you run and jump faster and higher, and you can set it to only do so while sprinting.
prerequisites: Need This and This and This...

tasks.longDescription: While the Wyvern armor has RF, it produces shield. This shield works as essentially extra health, a buffer before your actual health is damaged.

quests.name: Putting the "God" in "Gaudy"
quests.description: Draconic armor is the most powerful armor in the modpack. It allows you to fly, see in the dark, see Nodes, jump high, run fast, and step up single blocks. Wearing charged Draconic armor, you are nearly invincible; you can even survive an IC2 Nuke point-blank.

tasks.longDescription: Pretty much the only thing that  has the ability to damage you at this stage is the Chaos Guardian. That, or someone messing with Witchery.

quests.name: Upgrading Your Machines
quests.description: Dimensional Shards only spawn in RFTools Dimensions. These Shards allow you to upgrade your machines. Hold Shift on a machine to see what Infusing the Shards into them will do.

tasks.longDescription: Put the Shards in the slot to the left, and the machine into the slot to the right. It may take more than a stack to fully Infuse the machine.

quests.name: Who Said the Wither Was Hard?
quests.description: The Mob Grinder uses RF to kill mobs in front of it. It does not collect the items or XP, but it is capable of near instantly killing a Wither. It is also Wither-proof.
prerequisites: Need This and This and This...

tasks.longDescription: You can also put furnace fuel into it instead of RF.

quests.name: Chesty Crafting Furnace
quests.description: This chest has 234 slots, can automatically smelt anything inside of it 5 items at a time, and you has a crafting table inside of it.
prerequisites: This Is Going To Be Easy!

tasks.longDescription: You can also break the Draconic Chest and it will keep it's contents.

quests.name: What's the Opposite of a Vacuum
quests.description: The Energy Infuser quickly fills items with RF.
prerequisites: This Is Going To Be Easy!

quests.name: Wakey Wakey
quests.description: Awakened Draconium is the next and final tier of crafting materials.
prerequisites: This Is Going To Be Easy!

tasks.longDescription: See your Information Tablet for information on how to get Awakened Draconium

quests.name: The Endest of End Games
quests.description: You deserve it. This is one of the most complicated recipes in the modpack. This isn't it, however.

quests.name: My Little Friend
quests.description: The Draconic Bow is the most powerful bow in the modpack. With this bow, you can machinegun fire arrows. You can configure how powerful the bow is in the GUI.

quests.name: Where'd That Mountain Go?
quests.description: The Draconic Pickaxe is the best pickaxe in the modpack. It works similar to the Pickaxe of the Wyvern, but has extra modifiers and has larger maximums.

tasks.longDescription: I used a Golden Pickaxe because the model wasn't showing in HQM

quests.name: Diggier Diggier Hole
quests.description: The Draconic Shovel is the best shovel in the modpack. It works similar to the Shovel of the Wyvern, but has extra modifiers and has larger maximums.
prerequisites: I Swear There Was Dirt Here

tasks.longDescription: I used a Golden Shovel because the model wasn't showing in HQM

quests.name: ? Excalibur! ?
quests.description: The Draconic Sword is the second best pickaxe in the modpack. It works similar to the Sowrd of the Wyvern, but has extra modifiers and has larger maximums.

quests.name: By Our Powers Combined!
quests.description: The Draconic Staff of Power is the ultimate. It is a mixture of all of the other Draconic tools. It does the most damage, a whopping 60 damage (30 hearts), plus an additional 30% of the mob's health. It can be configured like the other tools.

quests.name: Goodbye Ground!
quests.description: Angel Rings. Creative flight. This is the end game. You're almost done.
prerequisites: {Sufficiently Advanced Tech}[Blood for the Blood God]

tasks.longDescription: Crafted using the Dire Crafting Table. Any Angel Ring will work.

quests.name: Give No Flux Capacitor
quests.description: The Creative Flux Capacitor gives infinite RF. You deserve it, man.
prerequisites: This Is Going To Be Easy!

tasks.longDescription: Crafted in the Dire Crafting Table

quests.name: Who Needs Reactors
quests.description: The Creative Energy Cell produces infinite RF at 100,000RF/t per side.

tasks.longDescription: Crafted in the Dire Crafting Table.

quests.name: Ocean in a Block
quests.description: The Creative Portable Tank allows you to have an infinite amount of any single fluid. One of the 3 craftable Creative items in the modpack.
